text:
This place rocks. Would come here very often if I still lived in Madison. Everything from the food, to the setup, to the décor is awesome. Not been to many places where you go to find more seating upstairs and it basically feels like you just got home. There are tables and then a whole loft-style area with couches and comfy chairs where people can hang out. But in an authentic way, not the forced Starbucks kind of way.

The food is stellar. Got the chorizo skillet which was amazing. My part also indulged in blueberry and raspberry scones which were awesome (taking cues from the other recommendations). I enjoyed a nice hazelnut coffee and then got the free refill! Also loved how you can take jars of preservatives/jam to your table to which were also delicious.

I really love Lazy Jane's because it is consistently great. Whether I am having brunch with friends on a Saturday morning or stopping in to grab a scone on my way to work I have never not been satisfied. 
Beyond the food, it is such a sweet spot that feels like you're in someone's home. You can't go wrong with this place.

They keep it simple but they get the basics right. Good service, excellent food and great value. Breakfast burrito is delicious.  There is a wide selection in the bakery. The interior and furnishings are simple at best but I cannot fault this place!

Eclectic, fun, different. Unfortunately I can't eat gluten - so those fantastic scones and muffins tease the crap out of me when I'm waiting in line. If you can eat that stuff, you'll LOVE Lazy Jane's! 
The breakfast creations available here are so yummy: funky cheeses, avocados, turkey bacon, etc. 
Oh yeah, awesome tea!
One minus, they could add another egg or so. I usually leave a bit hungry :). Maybe that's because I hold the potato too.

Scones are outrageously good. So is the SCC. They have recently been experimenting with not calling your name
out, which is a nice change, makes it quieter.

Warning: cash only.

I love brunch. The venue is a little cramped, but I love it. The great thing about Willy Street are the house-turned restaurants. Laz Jane's gives off that hipster/intimate feel in a way that I haven't found replicated by other places. Mickey's Tavern comes close with its upstairs antique shop, but I love the upstairs part of Laz Jane's. 

Their scrambles are delicious. If you are looking for an intimate brunch place, I would recommend this place, but you need to come early unless you're willing to wait. 

It's a great place to catch up with a few (up to a group of 5 would be my suggestion) friends on a weekend morning. You order at the counter and seat yourself. With a few couch seats (my favorite) and a bunch of small tables, you can have your own intimate gathering. 

There are many great brunch places in Madison, so if you're looking for what stands out, here's my opinion: come here if you want a hipster coffeeshop feel with good breakfast food

Good deal of vegetarian choices, but quality of products questionable.  Frozen fruit on their waffles leaves something to be desired.  Baked goods are fab, but the seat-yourself packed-house atmosphere may cause anxiety in the most grounded of people.  I like the play area upstairs for keeping restless kids entertained.  Overall, it's a cute place to go on off hours.

Huge scones at very reasonable prices! I feel guilty having a large scone for breakfast but it's so good that whenever I go I have to get more than one to keep for subsequent days' breakfast as well. Lemon cream scones are by far my favorite. I have something for anything lemon. This review is for the café but if you are just looking to get scones, there's a bakery just a few stores down where they have scones and a couple other pastries for take-out. And you get to skip the line as well.

In all the times I'd been there I have always experienced a wait. The wait times depend on how early you get there and whether it's a holiday weekend etc. Just order at the counter, pay for your order, get your coffee/pastries and grab a seat to wait for your food. Love their breakfast/brunch items especially the eggs. I have a soft spot for eggs as well. Yes yes, they are supposed to be easy to make at home but having it at Lazy Janes on a nice weekend morning with their interior decos really give me a cozy feeling and also warms up my day during the winter months.
All I've had from here is the iced lemon scone, but it changed my life. I thought I knew scones, until I met this game changer. It haunts my dreams.

General Suggestions:  Don't go during the weekend!  Have at least $10 cash per person.

I've been going to Lazy Jane's for years and have always had amazing food up until  the last two times.  I am not sure if I was simply unlucky, but I felt the consistency problems should be reported.  On the last visit, I went with some friends from out of town and all four breakfast items were cold and tasteless.  I had never had such bland tasting food at Lazy Janes, even their potatoes were not the same.  

On the last two visits I ordered my usual morning bun as well and both times it was extremely dry and not the same as I had been getting for the past five years.

If you go there during lunch hours, I would recommend the artichoke heart sandwich, always a good choice.  Though I do not like potato chips in general and their homemade ones are no exception, I would reccommend substituted for the greens, as they have a very peculiar, strong dressing they top them with that does not agree with my tongue.

The staff is always very warm and welcoming.  The seating situation is laid-back which is nice, but also annoying if you have a large group.  What I would like to see is an additional location opened.



I hope my next visit is the Lazy Jane's I used to love...

OK - how fair is a 3 star review? Well, Yelp tells me that it means A-OK. So I think it's legit. Let me preface though by saying that I didn't eat any of the pastries - I hear good things, so maybe I'll revise this up after I have.

So why?
1. The food was fine. I didn't have any complaints, but I wasn't overwhelmed either.

2. Tables - Rob P's assessment is pretty much dead-on I'd say. I felt like I was competing at musical chairs. That can be fun, but sometimes you just want a little more organization to the process (ala Marigold). Must have been one of those days for me...

3. The convenience factor is kind of meh. Small parking lot and I don't live over there. Again, it can contribute to the overall atmosphere (I love Brasserie V and no one ever accused them of even having a parking lot...), but I guess I'm not in love with the kitsch scene.

I'll probably go back and I wouldn't anyone to NOT go there, but if I was making breakfast/brunch recommendations - I would probably suggest a double handful of places in Madison before Lazy Jane's.

I have just found my new favorite breakfast spot in Madison. Wow. The reviews are right, the scones here are the best I've ever had. But if you prefer more savory breakfast items, the scrambles are incredible too. I had the salmon scramble, which tasted light and fresh - it was heavenly. The chorizo scramble has a hardier taste, but is equally delicious. The wheatberry toast and their jams are worth trying too!! 

Something also needs to be said about the homey environment here - it is so inviting, and despite serving such great food, it isn't at all pretentious. I came here with about 10 friends, and while I know this place can be a little crowded during normal brunch hours, we found seating right away. 

Nothing beats good breakfast in a friendly environment with people you love - I will most definitely be back!!

I was visting a friend in Madison from Boston and she took me to Lazy Jane's on a  Sunday and I loved it! I am gluten free and found that everything tasted delicious-- right down to their gluten free scones YUM! Free coffee refills, friendly and creative vibe, perfect brunch place. Hope to go back soon!

Best scones I've every had, especially the cherry ones. This is a very charming family-friendly place for breakfast so bring the kiddos. It's like eating at grandma's house, it's that cozy and sweet, with some retro touches and you can eat in the attic too. The food was delish--pumpkin pancakes and an artichoke scramble. Did I mention the scones? I would give it 5 stars, but the limit on coffee refills is a problem and a downer--just have free coffee refills available upstairs please!

Be prepared to wait awhile, because there will be a line..but worth the wait! Breakfast was delish! Scrambled eggs w/ cream cheese & green onion is a must have!! They also have a great bakery with some of the best scones I've ever had..we tried the lemon, maple nut and almond joy scones...all of them were yummy!

*cash only
*parking is not easy

I have tried several of their scones and breakfast meals.  I have been impressed every time.  I love the cheesy grits, the lemon scone (omg, seriously, the lemon scone), lemon ginger tea.  

BUT if you have not been before, weekends are crowded.  I haven't been earlier than 10am, but it is packed with a line out the door every saturday or sunday I've gone from 10-12.  Also, only open till 2, cause it's more a breakfast place.  But go chill out upstairs when they are super packed.

Lazy Jane is my favorite cafe in Madison along with Sophia's. I love how they call my name when my food is ready--it reminds me of having breakfast at my parents' on sunday morning! 
I like to munch on their muffin tops and/or scones while waiting for my fritata with sour cream--which has a huge portion.
My friends and I end up having wonderful time every time we visit and dine here. Oh and their freshly baked chocolate croissant is so perfectly crips and flaky and everything nice! I truly miss here!

Have eaten here many many times over the past 6-7 years. Their scones are delish, for sure. 

But everything else is underwhelming including their coffee (and their cream pitchers are always lukewarm). I always like to try tofu scramble at breakfast places and Lazy Jane's version is just weird: it's cubed tofu with vegetables, like a stir-fry, NOT like tofu scramble. A good version is light and fluffy like scrambled eggs.

I go there when it's the only option.

Lazy janes has quality bakery, especially their scones, which are some of the best (start with a lemon or berry-flavored one). The interior is cozy and charming, a place that is enjoyable to spend time at. The food is decent - the tomato soup in particular is delicious, but really I come here more for the pastries and to hang out than for a meal.
Came up from Milwaukee looking for a cute place to get breakfast and this place was great! Super cozy. Perfect egg's and diced potatoes. Super friendly service and amazing scones!

I was anti-scone until I came to Lazy Jane's.  That all changed after I took my first bite of a lemon creme scone.  It was life-changing.  5 star scone all the way.  And after the lemon creme, I tried every other variety, and was never disappointed.

I had breakfast here several times and it was always good, but really the scones are what kept me coming back.  Go here and please eat a scone for me.   

Notes:  You can skip ahead in the line if you are just getting scones.  So that's a definite plus.  But they don't take credit cards, so that's a minus for me.  They do have an ATM inside.

Great atmosphere, great food.  A friend and I came here on a Saturday around lunch time and the place was pretty busy, but we ordered and received food in less than 10 minutes (it may even have been closer to 5 minutes).  Everything was just as we had ordered it, and delicious.  Loved this place and would highly recommend it to all!

just got back from having a delish breakfast. my artichoke heart, whole garlic, spinach, sun-dried tomato pesto, asiago cheese scramble was marvelous. they have a number of fair trade coffee flavors, baked-daily scones and buns, and all the charm you could ask for.

it's been a while since i've eaten lunch there, but the open-faced melts are excellent, as well is the grilled cheese with avocado.

you with the little ones, there are tons of toys and books upstairs near the couches; just be sure to pick up when you leave! it feels like your living room, but it belongs to everyone. also, it's a bus-your-own place, so when you're done eating, find the closest tub and help out the staff by putting your dishes in it.

be prepared to drop $20 for two with coffees and a tip. if you like cozy, livingroom-like dining experiences with a little kitsch, this place is for you.

i oedered the seitan hash because the previous reviews raved about it, but i have to admit i was disappointed. the scones were good, but i am used to them not being so sweet. oh well.

the staff is great, the ambience is perfect to wake up slowly and even though i did not like my food so much i can tell they care about the food they are making and that they do so with love. I would still recommend this place to anyone who wants something a little different.

i'm a fan!

You just have to love this place!!  The decor is just so cute!! I love how they have couch seating upstairs that allow you to feel 'just like home'...  
Teresa, who took our order at the counter, was just an awesome sweet lady!!  She definitely made a visitor like me from California all warm and fuzzy inside with her kind hospitality.
My husband and I tried the daily special grilled chicken sandwich. This is probably the juiciest chicken sandwich I've ever had!!  I have never been a breast lover but they were able to make it so juicy that I had forgotten I was eating white meat!!  The sandwich had a layer of fromage fort (which is Wisconsin cheese blended with various herbs) which was a killer for me since I love soft cheese and herbs.
Thank you for making our first lunch meal on our Wisconsin so memorable!!

I go here at least once a week, sometimes more. The food tastes like it is made with love! The staff are seriously the best ever. They feel like family! Every so often a dish will disappoint me but when you eat as much as I do, it's bound to happen.

The scones are unbelievably good. I wish I could have them shipped to LA to arrive at my door fresh every morning. Lemon, mocha chocolate chip, regular chocolate chip...so sad that I haven't had one of these in years!

They gets four stars, though, cuz they need a separate gimme-all-your-scones counter.

This place is gloriousness on a plate, and a coffee cup.  I stumbled on Lazy Jane's one summer biking around the lake and now come back everytime I am in town. Everyone here is amazingly friendly, always offering free food to first time customers.  I havent ever had anything besides the egg and vegetable omelette because I dont want to mess with a good thing, but friends have raved about the homemade granola and other bakery items.  This place is always really busy and there isnt a lot of seating, so you will need to wait on the weekend, but while you are, you can look at the art from local artists that is displayed and for sale and wait for your name to be screamed in a welcoming way by the cook knowing that your food is ready. This place is good stuff!
Go there.  Be patient while you wait in the line.  Eat a frittata and a scone.  If you haven't done this already, you're missing out in a big way.

My favorite breakfast place in Madison.

Insanely good bakery. Fantastic coffee. Friendly service.  Hearty food.

Everything I've ever had here has been filling and fresh.
And no matter the time of day or how busy they are, the service has always been with a smile.

Bummer they only accept cash, but the ATM is right but he register.  No matter how crowded, there's always a place to sit.  

Protip: While standing in line, think of a clever name for your order!

Oh yeah, had the pancakes here the other day along with 2 egg and a side of bacon and it was smashing.  Don't let the line scare you, there is a lot of seating inside and the food comes out pretty darn quick after you order.  

An excellent spot for brunch or breakfast on Saturday or Sunday (I'm sure all other days too).  Looking forward to coming back and trying something else as long as the blueberry pancakes don't call me in....

Great food and service in a cool part of Madison. Willy St is historically the hippie/artsy fartsy area of downtown Madison, so be prepared for this kind of culture in Lazy Jane's. The women who work behind the ordering counter are always fun and helpful, not to mention polite, even when they're swamped. The stuff is all made from scratch and the combination of the food and environment lends the feeling that you're a kid again eating at your weird aunt cathy's, but its awesome. I recommend the tuna melt or Rueben sandwich for lunch and a frittata for breakfast. Oh, and don't forget a scone! They're known for them.

There's a reason Yelp's overall rating is an average.  Restaurants can vary based on day of the week or time of the day.  I know this place has potential, but I was underwhelmed.  

Imagine a breakfast place where you stand in line to place your order, you then proceed to stand around like a vulture trying to find a table to open up (It's can be competitive).  You then sit down to babies crying, people STOMPing up and down the stairs, people squeezing past your table to claim their table,  people re-squeezing past your table to retrieve their food downstairs (more STOMPing), people re-squeezing past your table to bring their food back, then again to get the condiments they forgot. You get the point? This place is a commotion.  Kind reminds me of Ian's Pizza at bar time...except it's Sunday morning and you're trying to enjoy breakfast.  Occasionally they have to holler out people's names that didn't come to claim their food.  It's loud.

The above may be a bit harsh, but it's the truth, and not an extreme example. That said, LJ's could have a nice appeal to it when it's not the weekend.  I imagine they could have a nice relaxing place when there aren't 100 people in there. 

My food was nothing special.  Biscuits and gravy.  The biscuits were a bit dry.  I'd give them a 3 star. My girlfriend had the Chorizo scrambler. Picture attached. Pretty decent.

On a positive note:  The orange coconut white chocolate scone was awesome.  As Corey D says, "It's bananas!"

The food was pretty good, but not good enough to make up for the complete lack in all other areas.  I couldn't even order my food without the pretentious clerk behind the counter acting like i was an idiot for not knowing where the line started, even though there was only one person in line in front of us when we first walked in.   I get that the place is supposed to be laid back and a self serve type of thing but they need to have signs or a more helpful and friendly staff for first timers.  Then after we already felt a less than warm welcome we went to get our food from the counter, we heard our name screamed out,  and started walking away with the two plates they put out.  We quickly realized they weren't correct and turned back to see what happened when the lady cook told us in a rude tone that we should check with them before taking a plate.  Just so they know we are not their employees and they should probably put the right plates up before screaming out our names. long story short i have never written a review on yelp but left this place annoyed enough to do so.

I've been here twice now- both times for breakfast/brunch on the weekend and enjoyed both of my experiences. 
The first time I got the iced coffee (which you can get a free refill on!), blackberry scone, and the frittata and enjoyed everything. The person I was with got the butterscotch chip scone and the breakfast burger. Both of his looked and sounded amazing but were pretty disappointing- the butterscotch chip scone was too dry (the moisture from the berries in the blackberry one helped cut the dry-ness quite a bit) and I feel horrible saying this but the breakfast burger was just bad... the meat wasn't seasoned at all and it was overcooked- my friend ended up not eating any of it because it was so unappetizing. 
On the other hand, the second time I went I got the hot coffee (also comes with a free refill), morning bun, and the chorizo scramble while the person I was with got the turkey omelette (on the special board) and the blackberry scone. The chorizo scramble was delicious (especially with the green poblano Cholula hot sauce). My friend really enjoyed his omelette and the raisin toast he got with it. The morning bun was really good but it'd be pretty hard to mess up bread coated with cinnamon and sugar (the outer crust kind of reminded me of a palmier cookie). 

I love the upstairs dining areas because it feels very cozy and homey but it can get extremely loud depending on who is up there which can considerably distract from your dining experience so depending on the noise level, the downstairs area may be better. There are serving/condiment stations and bathrooms on both levels though which is super convenient.

I also really like how they have a wide variety of types of breads you can choose from for your toast and they also have delicious preserves on the side counter which I highly recommend trying. They have raspberry, strawberry?, and orange peel. At the downstairs condiment station they also have soy milk, 2%, cream, brown sugar, simple syrup, regular sugar, etc, etc so you really have access to everything you could want to add to your coffee which is really nice.

All in all the egg-based food and pastries I've had there are very solid and the staff there is friendly even though their constantly swamped.

Cozy, quirky and very Madison, Lazy Jane's is a Willy St. staple. If you weren't convinced by the thrifty, hodgepodge decor or the big Scrabble letters outside, try one of their ridiculously delicious scones. The gluten-free lemon cream scone is the only GF baked good I've ever had that doesn't taste like it.

Cute, homey, tasty food, toys for kids, gluten-free bread, home-brewed kombucha.  Managed to feed a collection of adults, including two gluten-free people and one lactose-intolerant and soy allergic person, plus entertain multiple young children.  Nice work!  Now just make some tasty gluten-free scones and I'll love you forever and give you all the stars I can.
Adorable, quaint coffee house with comfortable food. Peppermint mocha was so good! Blackberry scone was great. Lots of pastry options!

It was a very interesting place to say the least.  I had a scrambled egg, toast, bacon and potatoes. Honestly, I liked the food.  The only quips I have about the place are that my toast was horribly over-toasted and it took forever to get the food.  Of course, the latter may have had to do with the fact that it was just after a rush and on Memorial Day.

I think I'll have to go back and see what the coffee and lunch type food is like!

Sometimes the line gets long, especially in the later AM on Saturdays and Sundays for brunch but great food, and great atmosphere!
The speedy Eggwich is amazing!
Great scones too!

As other reviewers have mentioned. come here for the scones! This place has, hands-down the best scones I've had in my life. I got the orange chocolate chip scone, just utter perfection. 

We also got brunch food -eggs (with cream cheese) and coffee. The eggs were okay, wasn't a big fan of the cream cheese combination. The potatoes though!! It's probably the best roasted potatoes I've ever had. Most places make it kinda dry, this one is soft and so greatly seasoned. Perfect texture and taste. Yummyyy!

All in all, I'm a fan of this place. It can get crowded so expect to wait for a seat, hover around and be aggressive or else you won't get a group table. Food takes forever too. If I'm in a rush I would go here just to grab the scones and leave. Too bad I don't live in the East side; otherwise I would come here probably at least once a week for a scone!

Good food.  Really busy.  Its hard to negotiate between tables, chairs, screaming children, etc. with a full cup of coffee.  I got the granola with fruit/yogurt and my bf got the seitan hash.  both really delicious and my coffee was bottomless and we felt all in all very cozy, until we had to stand up that is :)  
Go early or go really late, maybe that is the secret?

The restaurant itself it really cute and very "Portland" feeling - laid back and hippy.  The food i found was only so-so.  I had the chorizo & eggs plate - couldn't find any chorizo in it, assuming it's ground so tiny it's only adding a little bit of flavor.  I found it to be fairly pricey for what was received.  Cute place to sit around and drink coffee, but if you're looking for a good value breakfast, I would wait until you get to the Capitol square.

Wow. I really, really love Lazy Jane's. The scones really are THAT good and there is truly nothing better than waving that big Bakery Express Wand to get them. And coffee snobs may think it's trashy, but I am so glad they have hazelnut coffee.

The key to Lazy Jane's is to go very early on the weekend or really, any time during the week - it's small! Last week, I brought in Lazy Jane's scones for my office and I think I'm now everyone's favorite co-worker. I never noticed a bad attitude from the staff or fellow patrons. I wish I had kids so they could play in the adorable kid nook upstairs with toys, books and comfy couches! 

If you do insist on a late morning meal with a party larger than 2 on the weekend but can't handle the line, here are my tips to deal with it: check out the board, decide what you want, tell the designated "order-er" of your party, go grab a seat, and be happy.

I lived in Madison for a year and managed to not discover Lazy Jane's scones until the weekend before I moved. Phew. If I had known about the amazingly tart-but-still-sweet-enough raspberry scones with their excellent texture I would have had at least 2 a week and would have never fit in any of my clothes again. To repeat a common refrain - really, really good scones!
Waited an hour in line. Fitata was ok, but nothing to brangs about. Hated the automatic tipping - which is ridiculous for complexly self-serve. Not worth the wait.

Do you guys put crack in your eggs?  Why are they so good?  For breakfast, I almost always get the works with turkey sausage and English muffin.  Yeah this place has long lines on the weekends.  That's because it's good ya fool.

The scones and baked goods are great. The breakfasts are very good. The staff is friendly.Be prepared for a wait. The restaurant is not as clean as I would like, and I have often found that the silverware needs an extra rinse.

This place is fabulous! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!! I moved here two years ago from Vermont (originally NH) And as soon as I walked in, it felt like I had been transported back to Burlington, Vermont.... which is a fabulous place by the way. There is adorable charm with wholesome food, great service, great prices, great portions and great vibes. I loved everything about it. That cafe feel meets diner food. Not only was I pleased with the food, i was pleased by their accommodations to Gluten free eaters like myself. Definitely come here! I even got just a regular cup of coffee... nothing fancy... but it was SOOOO GOOOOOOD. Love this place!
amazeballs. seitan hashhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh nom nom nom nom nom nom good for me good for you good for baby drinking out of my boob

I absolutely love Lazy Jane's!  The food is always delicious, the staff are warm and nurturing and the upstairs seating is awesome.  I have had many things both sweet and savory and have never been disappointed.
Best scone we've ever had, and the bfast tostada was also delicious. Friendly staff, good strong coffee too. Loved the unique colorful decor and furniture!

Breakfast is my favorite meal, and Lazy Jane's is my favorite breakfast place. They have the standard eggs, pancakes, and baked goods, but they put a unique twist on each item. Occasionally, when new cooks are being broken in, the food might not be consistent, but they are usually on the ball and your meal might be ready before you sit down.

I love the converted house as restaurant, and hearing the orders called out is always amusing. If you've been there more than twice, Sadie will likely remember your name and standard order. Yes, the counter wait sucks during the rush hour, and finding seating the right size for your group can be tricky. But it's a small price to pay for good food at a great place. Just don't hold up the line. I might be behind you.

Amazing service, gluten free scones! I have severe allergies to some grains and they were so helpful - even escorting me to their bakery to look at the scone ingredients - which I was able to eat and were so dense yet moist. We are on the road and in a hurry. Food to go was fast and coffee was perfect! The next we pass through we will definitely be stopping by!

If you're looking for a great sit down breakfast spot to have a relaxing breakfast with little fuss, don't head to Lazy Jane's.  However, if you're looking for a friendly, eclectic, spot with good food and a chance to meet other patrons, Lazy Jane's is your place.

Order at the counter, and then wait till you can find a table.  You pick-up your own food, bus your own tables, and may need to share a table with others during the busy periods.  Vising in the winter gives it the feel of a ski-chalet camaraderie.

Their breakfast menu was hearty, though the hot apple and rhubarb compote was a bit to tart and the granola with fruit and yogurt had fruit that was still frozen.  

Lazy Jane's is definitely a place to check out at least once.

We just had our 2nd lunch here and, once again, Lazy Jane's delivered.  The tomato basil soup is enough by itself to get me in the door.  Husband and I each had soup and sandwich.  Mine was well balanced and tasty.  Same for the other sandwich as well.  Someone knows how to combine the flavors to compliment each other.  The breads are fresh and carry the load well.  The decor is eclectic and entertaining.  Love the numerous needle point pictures that adorned the eating area.

Lazy Jane's is a cute little breakfast/lunch spot that my friends and I love to go to! It is in a little house off of Willy street, and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. I really like their egg dishes- eggs with turkey sausage, frittatas, egg scramblers, etc. My boyfriend loves the BLT, and I really enjoy the turkey sandwich melt (a cold sandwich that I ask for warm). The service is sometimes a little slow, but the food makes up for it! CASH ONLY!

The scones are AMAZING.

Some dishes can be a little on the salty side, but overall its tasty.

Oh my goodness, the SCONES!
They are just perfectly crumbly and perfectly buttery.
When my friends say they don't like scones, I immediately take them here.

Because of the chaos on weekend mornings, I always make sure to go here for a weekday brunch.
The ingredients are fresh, and the staff are so friendly!

Just FYI, they don't accept debit or credit cards. ONLY CASH!

I'd give this place 5 stars if I was voting on the scones alone.  But alas, they muck up the delicious scone menu with other breakfast items. I kid.  It's a fairly solid local breakfast joint that happens to serve out of this world scones.  

Go for the lemon cream scones! Now! They are heavenly.

The other food stuffs are really just OK.  There's almost always a long wait and their lattes are consistently horrible.  That said, the other items on the menu are fairly good, definitely not a destination restaurant but great if you're in that neighborhood. Remember to bring cash, CC are not accepted.

Go for: scones, SCC (scrambled eggs, cream cheese, chives) if you need a protein fix, or try one of their daily specials which are usually better than the regular menu items
the homey, eclectic east side feel

Skip: the lattes
Kickin' cottage ambiance and a fun menu. I love this place and always go back for more sooner or later. Just be careful going during the rush (they get packed, but you can make it happen).

Best scones in Madison -- no the Midwest! Homey, eclectic atmosphere. Always busy. Good location, minus the Willy St. construction (Summer 2011)... the only thing I find mildly 'disruptive' is the fact that they give an obnoxious shout of your name when your food is ready.
Awesome local place for breakfast!  Do yourself a favor, regardless of what you order, make sure to get a lemon scone.

I have been going here for years and thoroughly enjoy the  food, the coffee, and the overall atmosphere.  

The reason I gave it two stars is simply because my girlfriend nicely asked the cook in the window if her meal was ready.  The cook responded with a supremely snide remark in a very abrasive tone.   This was completely uncalled for and rude.  There was no reason for this cook to respond this way.

They have phenomenal food and coffee.  I am concerned that there customer service is going in the wrong direction.

Stopped in for breakfast with the wife. Nice little spot with friendly staff just order at the counter , sit yourself and wait for your name to be called. Had the Chorizo scramble based on reviews and it was  very good. Not normally a scone fan but tried a raspberry one because of all the good reviews and that was very good as well. My wife liked her cinnamon french toast. Parking is pretty tight right in front of door.

Love this place!! 

Delicious, hearty, breakfasts, as well as awesome bakery items. 

Make sure you either get their really early (like before 9am) or late morning (around noon) because they get very busy during peak hours! 

Also:  Make sure you have cash, they don't accept credit cards!

1. Scone amazing
2. Frittatta, jah?

This is the best place to be when it's raining midweek, or for a weekend brunch (it gets a little hectic). Great decor, great food, great setup.

There are costumes for the kids! I wish I could wear them.

Feels like home

Yes, Lazy Jane's will redefine the word "scone" for you.  Scones aren't supposed to be the dry leaden vaguely sweet hockey pucks most coffee shops and restaurants serve. Nope- they are supposed to be light and flaky and buttery and flavor/fruit-filled. In other words, just as they are at Lazy Jane's.  I am a breakfast/brunch regular here because it's just so darn reliable. Sure, I could make myself a salami/provolone/mushroom scrambler with a side of turkey sausage at home... but for 8 bucks, why not cuddle up in a cozy corner at Lazy Jane's with some of their delicious coffee and- bonus- a scone too! The prices are beyond reasonable here and the only thing that's not absolutely delicious are their breakfast potatoes (just plain cubed potatoes- you could do worse). As someone who doesn't typically eat potatoes or toast anyway I really appreciate that at LJ's you can ask for no potatoes/no toast and not only do they smile and say "Okay sure!" they reduce the price as well.  Yup, it's just counter service but it is GREAT SERVICE HERE. 

I swear by their weekend specials and pretty much always order off that specials menu on the chalkboard- unique scramblers, omelets, French toast etc- but if they've run out for the day, I have the standby Chorizo Scrambler from their regular menu (secret: their fresh house made salsa served with that scrambler is totally on point!) Don't be scared off by the line. It's an efficient ordering system and it's all part of the charm.

Great little cozy, kitschy breakfast place. 

I love the setup of self - service... I  get to monopolize the jams and hot sauces without judgement. 

We ordered the cherry scone,  chocolate croissant,  raspberry scone,  the Works (toast, choice of meat - bacon, skillet potatoes, and two eggs), and chorizo scramble; comes with toast and potatoes. 

The scones are what they are famous for and they exceed my expectations. Crumbly yet rich, flavorful goodness. They had easily a handful or more choices today. The croissant had a crusty exterior with a soft doughy interior with generous amount of milk chocolate. 

The breakfast plates were also phenomenal. Crispy bacon and potatoes. Eggs cooked just how you like them and the salsa that came with the scramble was fresh,  almost straight from a garden fresh! 

All that for $25 before tip.  Beware, checks and cash only.

To be honest, I only got a Scone and Coffee here....However......

Really cool place I plan to visit again because....

1. I thought Scones we're just really old pastries until I came here. Damn good!
2. I want to hang-out next time, great place to do so.
3. Menu looks great and it's priced very reasonable.  (1 Egg, Potatoes and Toast is $4.00)  I think an extra dollar will get you two eggs.
4. The place is crowded, another great sign I need to explore the menu some more.

I am glad I came here and encourage others to check this place out.  Go it alone or with a friend, neat place to people watch too.

I had a really bad experience today (3/18/2017) at Lazy Jane's, the man with the yellow tinted glasses treated me very badly! The restaurant has refused to change the information on the drinks board from free refills to only ONE refill, this includes coffee as well. When I pointed it out the answer I got was so sarcastic, and simply very bad attitude that I will not go back. And I bet he expected a tip for such bad behavior! The restaurant has changed too many of their policies to be a place I would like to go back to. I would give them less than one star if I could.

Hands down one of my favorite brunch places anywhere. The food is delicious but the atmosphere, decor, and staff make it all worth it. There are such warm, inviting vibes and it is a great place to take a group of friends or a date. Also it is moderately priced so it won't break the bank!

I frequent Lazy Jane's for 2 things:

1) The seitan hash (the only meat analog dish I'll touch)
2) To get sconed

This is one of my favorite breakfast spots in town.  I've run through a good chunk of the menu and it's all tasty.  I'm not usually a fan of the sweet stuff, but Lazy Jane's does it just right.  All the other reviews, are right: The scones are top-notch. 

I've gotta talk about that seitan hash.  This stuff is amazing.  It's meatier, more filling  and more savory than the non-veggie options.  I don't know what they do to make it so good, but keep it up!  If you need to have some meat, order it on the side.  

Prices are very reasonable, coffee is decent, portions are big and the staff is great.  Make sure to bring cash or hit up the ATM inside cuz you won't be using plastic here.  They've got a good mix of table sizes, so bring your SO, your friends or your entire extended family.  It gets busy on the weekends, so plan to wait a bit; it's worth it.

Sadly, they hand out buzzers on the weekends so no more [insert your NAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAME].
fun vibe, and great food. I LOVED my chorizo scramble. Scones and morning buns are amazing. Good coffee. Only disadvantage is you have to go downstairs to get your drinks refilled.

Went out for thrifting at SVDP and pulled up this coffee shop in the area. It's literally across the street from St. Vinny's. Cute hippie looking decor on the outside. People from all walks were coming in for afternoon lunch. Moms with kids, business women and men, and friends out for a bite. Thought to myself this is probably a hot spot.

I walked in for coffee and pastries only so I'm not rating on behalf of the eating experience. The entrance was narrow. Wasn't greeted friendly by the cashier. I asked if they had different flavors of syrup for handcrafted lattes. Was told..."they could make anything." Requested for a white mocha and was told they didn't have that syrup...LOL. Ordered a caramel latte and two fruit scones. The latte was mediocre - too much milk and the espresso was weak. Fruit scones were the bomb! The scones made up for my mediocre latte.

I went over to the coffee station to stir up my coffee and grab a lid. Saw the cooks putting up the food on the counter and it all looked delicious. I would definitely come back for a bite and update this review later.

The food is all made fresh and surprisingly fast. Better know what you want because you have to order and pay at the same time. There is usually a line, so if you don't like lines drive by first and take a look out front. The line usually goes by fast though. There seems to be a lot of locals from Willy Street who come here. Also a great place to grab a coffee and scone to go. The orange juice could have been better.
Great place! A must try in Madison. As everyone says, the scones are awesome!

I might be getting old, but this place doesn't cut it for me anymore. I try not to eat animal products (read: vegan), but often end up making exceptions when eating out. I wish there was a vegan version of the SCC. I love that that they have waffles (Jane isn't that lazy if she has waffles), but I'm over standing in line just to have to get my own food.  It turns out they have vegan waffles, which aren't on the menu and are made from scratch, so be ready to wait a bit.

The food is not bad but reminds me of an under seasoned bad diner.  The eggs were noticeably greasy and the staff unfriendly.  My friend swears by this place and why it gets two stars rather than one.

I was in Madison for a conference and came by this place though my hotel was on the other side of town. The coffee was good and the pastries were delicious. Have a croissant (any croissant) and you will not be disappointed. My favorite is the almond croissant. 

The atmosphere is what kept me coming to this place. It attracts people of all ages and reminded me what it means to sit down and actually enjoy someone's company and conversation while eating. I liked it. Good vibes coming from this place.

As a brunch aficionado, I must say Lazy Jane's ranks up there on the Madison circuit.  Scone selection was amazing, and really, all the baked goods looked delicious.  I had the veggie frittata which was quite yummy and the Columbian Italian coffee was on point.  Slightly weird that they served it in a pint glass...for a minute I thought I was having Guinness for breakfast.  Fiance indulged in the chorizo scramble special, which was also pretty tastey.  No wait at about 10am on a Saturday, which was surprising, though parking was kind of a  b-.  And I kind of liked how they sang my name!  Overall, good eats - I'll definitely be back!

I loved the decor and cuteness of this cafe. I originally wanted to go to Lazy Jane's for breakfast but didnt make it in time but ended up getting lunch. I ordered the soup and sandwich combo of half a ruban and French onion soup.  The sandwich was good but had a bit too much sauerkraut, however the soup was flavorless and needed a bunch more seasonings.   I hope next time I go I can make it for breakfast or order something better.

Wow what a great find in Madison. Probably one of the best breakfast places I have ever been too. You MUST try the scones and enjoy a hearty cup of joe with 'em. The staff was extremely nice and I enjoyed every minute of my experience for Saturday brunch. Be prepared for a lot of food at a great price. I can't recommend this place enough and am so happy I found it. Get there early to avoid lines!

This is really more like 3.5 stars but I rounded up because this place is just so gosh darn cute. My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday morning and were expecting a longer wait but we only stood in line a few minutes before it was our turn to order. I ordered the veggie scramble and my boyfriend ordered the standard breakfast with eggs, toast, and bacon. 

I think we may have gotten the wrong items because I honestly was just not that impressed by my scramble. It had a lot of veggies in it which was nice but was lacking in flavor and seemed like the sort of scramble I can toss together for breakfast with some leftover veg in my fridge. This, coupled with some hash browns that were also underseasoned, made for kind of a disappointing experience, considering I'd heard good things about this place and was expecting something funkier and more flavorful for a place on Willy St. I'm all for good simple breakfast food but if you're going for simple, I think it should be executed really well. The saving grace of the meal were the scones we picked up on the way out - a cherry one and a coffee chip one. They were buttery, rich, and delicious. I can't say I'd order the scramble again but think I'd come here for the baked goods and also to try another dish on the menu because the atmosphere is exceedingly pleasant.

Yes Lazy Jane's is very Willy streetish! The scrambled eggs with cream cheese and onions was excellent.The breakfast potatoes, crispy bacon, and scones we're very satisfying! They do have there own small parking lot to make things easier.

I have zero complaints about Lazy Jane's. The service was quick, even though they were busy. Free coffee refills and the best scones I've ever had! We tried the lemon cream and the blackberry - both were amazing. My husband had The Works (traditional breakfast plate), and I had a special that was a Greek scrambler (can't remember the name). Everything was fresh and well made. The environment is really cute and cozy - definitely a place to take your time and enjoy. It's cash only, and they have an atm inside.

L.O.V.E.D I.T.  Staff was friendly and the atmosphere was warm and comfy.  An old house converted, the upstairs seating offers more opportunity not to be in the thick of things downstairs.  Tables are scattered about along with cozier seating areas of armchairs and couches.  Decor is kitschy and includes a few smatterings of Christmas decor despite the fact that it's May.  Let's be festive, fine by me!   

At 11am on a Friday the place was bustling but tables were free without having to stalk (weekdays are probably the time to go, based on what I'm reading here... I never have the patience to deal with crowded shenanigans on a weekend).  Our food was ready in minutes and super tasty.  The Seitan Hash ($7.50) is served with marinated seitan (YUUUUM), potatoes & peppers along with a side of eggs & toast.  The Frittata ($7.50) was equally delish, nicely portioned (not overwhelmingly large) with fresh veggies and cheese on top.  Remember to load your plate up with any condiments (ketchup, jelly, etc) you may need before getting back to your table.  My only kvetch was that the jelly jars weren't labeled so I spent more time than the average bear trying to distinguish between red jams.  Cash only but overall things were quite reasonably priced, me thinks.  

Note: they do switch over from the breakfast to the lunch menu at 11am  (weekdays only) and staff did go through the line to determine who was there for breakfast before they made the official lunch switch (which consisted of flipping menu chalk boards around and declaring it would be lunch-only once new folks wandered in.  Fair enough!  Baked goods were tasty as well and it appears on weekends there is a bakery annex (for to-go bakery goods) to alleviate some of the restaurant crush --annex open from 7am-11am/12pm, probably whenever they run out!    

While I may not be brave enough to try my hand on a weekend, this is definitely a stop I'd add to my itinerary for weekday adventures.

Lunch, then coffee and a scone.  Lunch: 3.  Coffee: 4.  Scone: 5.

Total. About 3.5.

Starting with the best:  The great scone -- raspberry, slightly heated, cheerfully,  at my request -- was just moist enough, crumbly, with a nice lemon glaze.  Not too sweet, not too rich. Light and tasty.  Just what a scone should be.  Nice size, too.  Couldn't ask for more.  Except now I want to try all of them!!

Latte: quite fine.  Not memorable, but piping hot with good coffee/milk balance.  I have to have decaf (sigh) and it was almost strong enough, and not bitter.  I'm a visitor, so I  haven't had all the local coffees...a solid 4.  I remember Bradbury's as better espresso.

The tomato soup could have been a 4, but wasn't hot, and seemed a skimpy serving.  Both chunky and creamy, it had potential.  I think the bowl was barely half full, and the accompanying half sandwich was also small and a bit sad.  A few pieces of pastrami, a tomato slice, a small cheddar half-slice, and a limp lettuce leaf.  I saw someone else's veggie melt with salad and chips and it looked much better, so maybe I just chose wrong.

It was a pleasant place to sit and eat and work.  Next time, I will try breakfast instead of a sandwich.  Got there too late this time (yesterday.)

They have amazing amazing pastries! I can't get over their almond croissant!! I'm usually pretty picky about scones, but their scones are so perfect (for me at least). Their food menu is a bit limited, but simple and gooood. I have tried the chorizo scramble and the guacamole omelette. Both great. I love the salsa that comes with it too! Their regular coffee is good and they offer free refills for mugs, and I'm usually pretty happy with 2 cups. The ladies who work in the front are so bubbly and pleasant. I usually dock a star for things like environment, ease of parking, and restaurant capacity. Lazy Janes is surprising large, homey, and has a lot of seating. They also have their own parking lot. However, tables fill up fast and the cafe stays full until the kitchen closes. The upstairs area is my favorite! it is so cute with a variety of chairs / couches.

Their blueberry scone was the tastiest thing I've ever had! I am not usually a fan of sweets, but this hit the spot!

Cute, cozy little place. Hot fresh coffee. I tried one of their specials, which was a balsamic portobello melt. It was really hard to eat because it was drenched in balsamic, but between the scone and the coffee I was satisfied. 

Great prices and atmosphere. Would love to come back for another flavored scone! ^_^

I stopped here for lunch and pleasantly surprised by the swift and pleasant service. The food is tasty and the atmosphere is very enjoyable as well. Good sandwich, coffee and tea options. The sitting area is a little cramped, but not too bad!

Awesome brunch place!!!

It's always packed but you get seated in 10 and food comes by 20. 

Scones are delicious!!!! I love the savory ones! Quiches are great too. If you only want pastries, just walk down a couple of doors on the weekend and there's the pastry shop! And you can save the wait!

I also LOVE pigs in a blanket!! How has anyone not done sausage in pancakes before?! The Mac and cheese pancakes with andouille sausage are really good too!!

I also love the speedy eggwich, if you're into something simple :).  

My new favorite is the grits with sausage patties on the side!! Best thing ever and I always have leftovers!!! :):)
Amazing scones!  Great breakfast food.  All around wonderful little place.

While visiting Madison from KCMO, this place was recommended for brunch. Yay! We loved it. You order at the counter and then wait to be called back for your food order. I liked that I could order some a la carte items. I ordered the the Pig in a Blanket, and added an egg as a side. Also had some delicious hot chocolate. I really liked the mixed thrift store plates, and retro tables and chairs. There is seating upstairs and downstairs. If you find yourself in Madison, this would be a great place for breakfast, brunch or coffee.

Cash only!  ATM in-house.

The east side's quintessential breakfast spot.  Yummy food, neat seating, and they've got the food to back up their sass and humor.  Getting anything egg-related will leave you feeling happy, and then you can trundle on down to Batch Bakehouse to round out your breakfast feast.

Food is well made and tasty. Interesting interior and atmosphere. Good Italian soda. Good brunch place, but there are some better places in Madison. 

Probably deserves 4 stars if it was not for the following. No fresh juice.  No outdoor seating. A little slow. They don't take any cards.

This place never disappoints. They have it down to a science... Fresh food, prepared in a kitchen the size of a postage stamp by a staff who look like they were born on Willy St. The scones are incredible, the coffee strong, the scrambles inventive and the crowd a constant. In an effort to cut down on my intake I ordered a scone and two poached eggs, soft. My eggs were nothing short of perfect. A rare treat. Line appeared daunting but it moved quickly. Do not be deterred. Worth the wait.

As with everything amazing, be prepared to wait in line. I love everything on the menu, they had the best GF Scone I have EVER had.  Whenever I have a chance I visit.  Great place for some out of towers or even some West siders to visit and get a feel of East side Madison.

"SCONES!!!!!" to quote Ashley H.
I had a coworker mention they had a scone from here about two weeks ago that was heavenly so I had to go in and try them! I've been here before but mostly for their breakfast offerings.
This time around I came for an early lunch.
This place has delicious fresh foods with a lot of bang for your buck. 
I wish i could get here more often it's just such a great place.
Wonderful coffee and lattes. SCONES as we mentioned before- I had the lemon.
And the sandwiches are yum!!
A great value, I took my latte and scone to go becasue after getting my sandwich and realizing it came with a green salad and some chips for under $8.00. "Mind Blown"
I had to save the rest of my scone for later. My total check was under $15 and I pretty much had enough food to get me by until dinnertime.

Scones are incredible and the flavor combinations are creative. Had the orange coconut and white chocolate along with the raspberry and lemon cream. Took 6 home from the bakery next door and they lasted about 18 hours after we got home. Of course, not knowing that scone utopia awaited, I inadvertently made the mistake of ordering a full breakfast. Oh well. Worth it.

We went here for brunch on a Saturday morning. It was packed, and we barely got a table, even after waiting for a few minutes even after our food/coffee was ready. It seems a lot of people sit for hours after finishing their food/coffee, and despite announcements made out loud, they don't get up from their tables. This is counter service, with a small kitchen window where you pick up your coffee and food, and then find a table to sit. It's self bus at the end, but the dining areas are scattered throughout the house. Still, the food was good, as was the coffee, and the ambiance was unique, so I'm sure we'll go back - probably at a less busy time.

The line outside the door is hard to deal with especially when you don't want to hear everyone's cheerful banter about all the great things they're doing in life.  And when you're hungry, 30 minutes is too long to just order.

I order a chorizo scramble with pumpernickel bread, a lemon scone, and hot apple cider.  The cider was advertised to satisfy my seasonal craving but it truly did not.  Seriously lacking spices and warm at best.

The chorizo scramble didn't taste of chorizo, but rather a cheap American version of the sausage that had no bite.  

I'd come back for the scones, but who wants to wait 30 minutes for a mouth watering scone??
Absolutely fantastic PLACE to eat. Great people, interesting, cozy. The food is great. Almost a hipster place, but not quite.

The woman who works at the front counter is so rude, I've never been so mistreated at a restaurant, as well as my three friends who met me there. She stood there with a smug look on her face and refused to answer any questions about the menu.

East side GEM. A little old house converted into a breakfast/brunch joint. I've been several times and the food is always great. Sweet, savory... it's all good. 

There are lots of really good brunch spots in Madtown, but Lazy Jane's is up at the top.

Arrive at the wrong time and you'll wait for 45+ minutes in line to order, which is what happened to us. The good news was that food came pretty quickly once we had ordered.

I had the frittata with veggies, and my fiance had the biscuits and gravy. My frittata was a little bland and didn't have as many veggies as I had hoped. The cheese should be in the center not just on top. The biscuits and gravy were pretty good though. 

However, we ordered a bunch of pastries to go, and those were what really stood out. The sun dried tomato pesto and Asiago cheese croissant was amazing. As were the variety of scones we tried. Apparently you can pick up the baked goods at the bakery a few doors down and avoid the cafe line,  which is what I'll do next time!

Saturday morning at 9:30 and we ran into a half hour wait out the front door.  They moved things along quickly though.  I ordered their chorizo scrambler with potatoes and toast  on the side.  The scrambler was excellent, although I'll be back some day to try the frittata, which sounded just as good.  The interior of the place has a certain festive purple theme that feels something like Mardi Gras.  There were a handful of families eating here too, and the fairly spacious setup seemed right for a meal with kids.  All around, a great spot for breakfast.

One heads up though - they only take cash and while there is a low cost in-house ATM ($1.75 fee), there are no Chase ATM's anywhere nearby, as far as we could find out.

I was in Madison this weekend and I am glad I was able to make it back to LJ's! I had the S.C.C. this time and it was wonderful! The S.C.C. is scrambled eggs, cream cheese (yuuuum) and chives mixed together served with hash browns and your choice of toast. LJ's also has gluten free bread!! My brekkie was delish and I just love this little eatery. 

My party of four also shared a mud pie scone while we waited for our food. It was divine!!

I can't imagine I haven't written a review for this place. This was the among the first places I fell in love with after moving from NYC. It's these types of typical local small business I loved in NEw York. 

When ever we visited, the food has been consistently good. To my surprise, they have started accepting credit cards as well which is great. 

We started with a coffee and morning bun and a blueberry scone. Which were amazing. I must say- if u don't start with their treats, u are missing something. 

I ordered cheesy grits, pig in a blanket, my friends ordered frittata, steak and hash with toast. I loved my cheesy grits. Oh.. they were so good. Everyone loved what they were eating. I could tell because their plates were wiped out clean at the end. 

The line was long and we had to wait a bit but it was so worth it. I gave 4 stars because of coffee. It's a breakfast place and I was expecting the coffee to be better. It didn't have body and I was hoping for more flavor. 

All in all, a must visit for breakfast lovers.

Such a cute location! Service and food was excellent! Completely agree with the other reviews, the scones are amazing, my parents and I shared the lemon cream and the coffee chip. Super accommodating to modifications with the order. I order the "speedy eggwich" with bacon - excellent. My mother got "the works," she thoroughly enjoyed it. My father ordered the "chorizo scramble," he enjoyed his meal as well. The portions are a good size for the price. The side of potatoes was not my favorite, I prefer them super crispy. Next time I will just specified that I would like them well done.

A FUN dining experience!  And wonderful bakery items.  I don't like trying to listen for my name to be called because it's hard to hear.  But I think it's great how people literally make themselves at home, bringing board games to the table while they wait, etc.
Interesting place. Ordered the crazy pastrami omelet with blue cheese. Very tasty. Well worth the wait. I'd recommend and return. Plenty of seats upstairs too

Love this place! One of the best places to get awesome b-fast. Especially vegan b-fast. I love that they ask you when you order the tofu scramble if you're vegan and tailor your diet to the available bread and butter options.  Just try to not go during prime time otherwise your wait is going to be forever, but it's still worth it! They also do take out and the coffee is delicious.

Pro:
-great location near bike path
-hip crowd
-OK diner style food
-eclectic decor

Con:
-exceedingly hot in building
-noxious bathroom odor
-relatively long wait
-griddle stench head to toe upon leaving
-cold potatoes
-hip crowd

Not sure I understand where all the good ratings are coming from.  The "scones" are not scones in the traditional sense, but rather glorified biscuits that are really nothing special.  And as for the breakfast... we could have made way better at home.  Both the  strata and traditional plates were extremely boring and bland.  Definitely not worth the wait or the money.  If you want something amazing?... go to Daisy or just make it yourself.

I was lucky enough to visit Lazy Jane's this past weekend while I was in town visiting my sister. This is her favorite place and she was dying to take me here. I loved it as well!! Great food, awesome bakery (the scones were great as were the almond croissants) and the price is super affordable. I had the veggie frittata and my sister had the seitan hash and both were delicious. My hubby had the chicken salad on a croissant and my brother had a scrambler with pastrami and veggies and it was all delicious as well. I already can't wait to go back and try some more of their delicious food, I highly reccomend it here. Everyone was super friendly and because it was our first time here we got free scones, yum!

Lazy Jane's is the place I have to convince all my friends to go try, (a bit of a haul from campus) but then they end up loving it. Probably the best all-around breakfast spot in Madison with a prefect balance of quality, price, portion size, and atmosphere. 

Food is top-notch and always made to order. Has a very "homey" feel operating out of a renovated house on Willy Street. Pastries are enormous and pretty tough to pass up since they're just staring at you as you order. 

Their system is also pretty efficient, you just order at the counter and grab a buzzer. Food usually comes out in less than 10 minutes. Between a pastry and a skillet, you'll be full until dinner.

Always worth the trip, even if the line is out the door.

Update: came in this morning. It was pretty slow, so the staff wasn't busy. I very obviously was interrupting their conversation. Was asked basic questions. Woman at the counter did not say thank you, just "mmhmm" and immediately grabbed her phone and continued her conversation before I was even done signing the tablet. 

The ladies behind the counter are being incredibly loud. And loudly gossiping about who I am assuming is another coworker. Uncomfortable environment. 

Customer service is still severely lacking here. The product is great, guys! Don't ruin it with poor customer service!

Even their GLUTEN FREE scones are great! Therefore, it was incredibly disappointing to find none available during 2 recent visits. Staff offered some vague excuse about the availability of rice flour. Really? You could walk 2 blocks to the Willy St Coop to buy it in a pinch. Come on, LJ - GF folks like your scones, too!!

Been back several times and have not had nearly as much of an issue with the air quality.  Not sure if that is luck of the draw or an improved hood.  The food is still quite acceptable for the price and the location is great.

Highly recommend the avocado with pepper jack cheese on sourdough even if you're not a vegetarian! Delish kettle chips and salad (light dressing). The scone was good....but the frosting/cream on the lemon currant scone was a little too sweet for me. I will definitely go back to try their other scones...

Phenomenal scones. They have a unique breakfast and brunch menu that is very tasty but you have to go for the scones. The scones are made fresh every day and go quickly, so get there early. If you get there by 9 am there will still be a full selection of scones, including gluten free. 

My favorite scone is the lemon gluten free. I don't normally bother to do a GF diet, but these things are fantastic. Buy one for breakfast and one to snack on later that day. By the way, they are huge and probably the best value around based on size and price alone. 

The only drawback to LJs is that it is so popular there is frequently a line out the door and you might have to wait for a table. Try the breakfast and brunch menu on a quiet day and come back on a busy day just for the scones. 

Fun tip: the fry cook yells out your name for order pickup loud enough to hear it on the second floor. Yes, it's pick up your own order and clean your own table but the low prices are worth serving yourself (plus no tip needed).

I have two words for you: MORNING BUN. Sweet baby Jerome those things are delicious- wholly worth a visit alone BUT luckily there are plenty of other reasons to visit, too! Like the huevos rancheros, seitan scramble, vegan/gluten free options, AND delightful decor! I'm so deeply charmed by the folksy interior that they could probably serve old boots and I'd still come back. Love, love, LOVE you Lazy Jane's!

I am updating my previous review.
Since the first time, I have tried the scones, which are pretty amazing... most places just have basic, dry scones but these were moist (I hate that word) and they have at least 6 different options!  They are so good!  
I went there on Tuesday with some girlfriends and got the seitan hash for $6.50... Holy fricken moley! Amazing! This is a superb vegetarian dish that tastes just like meat!  It comes with the seitan seasoned to perfection, breakfast potatoes, 2 eggs, and your choice of toast (go for the sourdough rye).  This breakfast was so good, I made the bf bike there with me Wednesday morning... Yup, the very next day!  I could eat this meal every single morning!

No credit cards?  No way.  It's 2013.  And I don't buy the "it's too expensive for us little guys" stuff.  No, it's the cost of doing business.  I saw a woman taking cards at a garage sale last year.  Your call, but the food isn't that good and I can get great eats and kitch ambience anywhere in Madison.

Start a lovely weekend brunch out on Willie Street at this gem! I love Willie Street and my love for it was even more enforced after going here! From entering this place to ordering to sitting down and just enjoying the atmosphere, take a look at what I ate during my visit!
* Lemon Cream Scone: scrumptious! Moist on the inside and deliciously sweet and creamy on the outside with the lemon glaze.  Drink it with some tea and it's a ridiculously great start to the morning. 
* Soy Chai: and speaking of tea, grab this latte! While it was a little dirty spiced than I usually like it still hit the spot and the mug it comes in is just great. 
* Veggie Scramble: Fresh and filled with yummy goodies including spinach, mushrooms, and tomatoes. On top of that it comes with a biscuit that goes perfectly well with the jam that is in array in the condiments section. 
I loved the homey feel of this restaurant including the décor and closeness of all its patrons. Definitely a place to check out if you're in the area and in the mood for a home feel breakfast.

This is a lovely and affordable breakfast spot on Willy Street. I really like that this is one of those order at the counter places as it makes me feel more relaxed and less rushed when I'm eating. The staff was really friendly and from the looks of things there were a lot of people there that are regulars. Overall, my experience here makes me want to be more of a regular as well! 

First off, the scones are excellent. I even decided to save a little bit of $$ by ordering a day old blueberry and it was still delicious. They have a rich, strong brewed coffee as well, which is a must with any breakfast. 

I ordered a breakfast of scrambled eggs, an English muffin, breakfast potatoes, and turkey sausage. The turkey sausage had a really nice flavor kick to it and the breakfast potatoes were delicious as well. The scrambled eggs were pretty standard.

Just a small note: If you are coming during winter and you get cold very easily like me, make sure you have a light sweater or long-sleeve under your coat as there was a pretty strong draft coming from the windows.

Excellent breakfast spot in Madison. I ordered the waffle with berries and cream. This is the best waffle I ever had. Absolutely delicious. We also ordered eggs, potatoes, and toast with a side of bacon. This was good also.

This is a very nice breakfast & lunch place on the near-east side of Madison.  The scones are, by far, the best that I have ever had in any city (my personal favorite is the cherry scone)!  While I have never headed her for lunch, every breakfast entree that I have tried has been quite good, and there are always a wide array of specials in addition to the set menu.  There are also many options for both vegetarians and omnivores.

The only downfall in my opinion is the seating process.  While it's a piece of cake during slower times, it can be mass chaos during the rush (which is more often than not, especially on the weekend).  If everyone were to wait until after they ordered to secure seating it might work well, but there are always those people who save places and then get in line.  Seating for groups larger than 4 can be quite a tall order.  I would say that this is the main factor that keeps me from heading to this establishment more often than I currently do.

Lazy Jane's is one of the true gems of Madison. I love bringing out of town guests here. The food is amazing and the eclectic decor is so representative of its east side location. 

Today I had the caprese scramble: eggs with tomatoes, mozzarella and basil. It was wonderful. 

I often have the scramble with cream cheese and scallions. I like it so much I crave it.

Don't forget to get your scone on while you're there, or take one to go. I'm not kidding, you'll never eat anything like it. They are so good I have bought them for work events at the office.

I liked the location and setting inside the restaurant. It has a homey, comfy feeling. They support local artists by selling crafts inside the store. Their lemon cream scone was amazing! Definitely one of the best scones I have ever had. The consistency and taste was delicious. As for the actual breakfast, I had eggs, potatoes and bacon, which were good, normal. Really though, it gets a good review for the scone! I went on a late sunday morning and it was crowded but we only waited about ten minutes to get to the front of the line to order.

I say this as a guy who really, legitimately loves breakfast restaurant. This is my FAVORITE breakfast restaurant anyplace, ever. 

If there were one thing I didn't like about Lazy Jane's, it's that it is so good, that word has gotten out, so it gets crowded at peak times. Pro tip, go early, and you can enjoy a fabulous meal *with elbow room*.

I had the seitan scrambler, and everything was just perfect. The seitan (it's wheat gluten, naturally has a consistency a lot like tofu) was seared to perfection, which gave it a real neat and enjoyable texture. Almost like a steak. The marinade gave it the nicest twang. The potatoes were spot on, and my scrambled eggs came off flawlessly.

It was simultaneously a hearty breakfast, really artfully executed, with a little bit of hippy flair. Love it! Will def be back.

The scones: the best thing I put in my mouth while in Madison. I know, you're surprised. And don't get me wrong... the cheese, the ice cream, the beer, the Farmer's Market -- all great -- but the SCONES. For some reason, I've been generally non-exposed to scones. In my mind, they were akin to biscotti (dry, crumbly, desperate to be dipped in tea). No, friends. They are more like my (and every true Southerner's) best friend, the biscuit -- the perfect balance of light/dense, not overly dry, and beautifully buttery, pushed over-the-top thanks to a light-touch glaze. At Lazy Jane's they come in an assortment of flavors. The blueberry was bursting with in-season berries; the lemon, subtly tart; the cheddar, an amazing savory scone; chocolate chip scone, like a biscuit brownie! The only pastry letdown was the morning bun, which by comparison, was bland and surprisingly dry; skip it.

I found the spot incredibly charming. Waiting in line to order, peering in the pastry cases, and at the hand-written specials. Though we got there fairly early on Sunday, they were quite busy. Luckily, we snagged a great seat upstairs. The house is decorated with eclectic antique finds, and feels like an oh-so-cozy brunch spot. Yogurt with granola was inadequately portioned (more like: granola with yogurt), though the granola was crunchy, hearty, and delish. I thought the chorizo scramble was a win, but hubby was less impressed. Cash only is a little annoying. But ultimately worth it!

Lovely little two story cafe in a fantastic neighborhood!  The crew is jovial and the food; especially the scones, are out of this world.  One of a kind chef creations are featured daily for those who tire of the standard fare.

There is nothing lazy about Lazy Jane's in regards to the food and service.  Lazy Jane's has quality food and an ambience to match.  

I ordered the seitan hash and roasted tomato and pesto croissant.  Both items were exceptional.  The hash was seasoned well and was cooked perfectly.  The seitan was not dried out and had a nice chew, which was great because sometimes if done wrong it's like rubber.  At Lazy Jane's, it was made perfectly.

The roasted tomato pesto croissant though, was the star of the show.  Nothing against the hash it was great, but the croissant was one like I've not experienced before.  It was buttery, flaky, light, and just amazingly well put together.  The croissant alone was fantastic, but add the roasted tomato pesto filling, and you're in a whole different class.  I've not had a croissant with filling before, but I will be seeking them out after this experience.  The filling enhanced the croissant because it brought more balance to the croissant.  The rich butteriness of the dough was evened out by the sweet tart tomato pesto filling, and I wish I had bought more (but couldn't I got the last one, so be there early).  The croissant is a must try.

The food was exceptional, but I would be doing you a disservice if I did not speak about the ambience of Lazy Jane's.  It's a home, and I mean that.  Lazy Jane is a home converted in a restaurant, but it did not lose it's "homey" feel.  The hospitality and service given was great, and you just feel comfortable as if you were visiting a relative's house.  The atmosphere definitely contributed to the experience at Lazy Jane's.

Everything about Lazy Jane's was great, and if you haven't been, you are missing out.

Side Note: The scones were also amazing.  I bought 3 different ones the blueberry, strawberry peach, and coffee chip and all were just phenomenal.  Buy some for the next day because if you don't you'll regret it.

Needed to try a new place for breakfast on a day off of work, and was very happy with my choice. 

Ordered at the counter and waited an appropriate amount of time for them to call my name. Picked up some silverware and a napkin and headed to my table. I was a little disappointed there wasn't any jelly for my toast, but I noticed later, after I'd finished my toast, there was a jar at another table and they just hadn't returned it to the community condiment table. 

Ordered the spicy pork omelette, which was hot and delicious and came with a perfect sized portion of potatoes and two slices of buttered toast. 

Now I'm just hanging out at my table waiting for someone to leave because I don't know if I'm supposed to bus my own table! Wait... Someone's leaving... Yes. Bus your own table.
Obsessed with this place! Cute brunch place with a lot of gluten free pasteries that actually taste good! This place is cash only

we made the mistake of going to lazy janes on a sunday at 11am. The line was out the door, and seating was difficult. however the atmosphere is great. a fantastic place to bring kids. They have a child play area upstairs. The place itself is well decorated. and the food was good. however, on a sunday at 11am- expect to wait. i think we waited at least a half an hour for our food. at least.

Until recently I had only ever been here for breakfast. However, their lunch is just as tasty! Ambiance is great, healthy options while still having that comfort food feel. Must have the hazelnut coffee
A blackberry lemon scone and my mint tea were a perfect afternoon treat.  Visiting Madison for the week, it felt more like home as I enjoyed conversation with the sweet owner of Lazy Jane's.

I was greeted immediately and personably by a friendly woman and man. They recommended bakery items based on my interests, as well as a breakfast sandwich. They also offered flavored iced coffee, which is a rare find because many places will flavor with syrup, but not cold brew a flavored coffee. Food was great; service was genuinely friendly. I will definitely be back!!

Great little breakfast place.  Service is fairly fast once you get through the ordering line.  The food was all fantastic and I enjoyed the coffee.

Jane ain't lazy in the kitchen.

This is becoming an east side institution, run by a family who also owns Mickeys, Tip Top and other solid spots across Madison.

Great ambiance in this fun little breakfast place. It's hard to find parking or a table because it's that good. Lunch sandwiches come with chips and greens. For breakfast, get the Works: toast, choice of meat, skillet potatoes, and two eggs.

I like to make up a name for them to yell, usually Ignatious. Stella is so overdone.

If I owned this place, I'd do checks and cash only, just like they do, to avoid CC companies from takingmy hard earned money from customers. Pay in cash.

There are scones and then there are scones made from Gods. Lazy Jane has perfected the scone and brought it down from the heavens for us all to share and enjoy. Because of the scone, I have become a regular to this brightly colored two story house, stopping by to grab a scone and a coffee on my way to work. Outside of their blessed scones, their breakfast and lunch food is also truly amazing. I recommend grabbing your cash, getting there early to avoid the lines and order an amazing breakfast with a scone to go. While you wait for your name to be called out by the fun loving chefs, nibble on your scone and enjoy coffee. Once you have enjoyed your breakfast, take whatever remains of your unearthly scone with you to savior for later!

We have always like Lazy Jane's.  The staff are always friendly and courteous.  Lazy Jane's is nestled in the heart of one of the best neighborhoods of its' type in Madison, Willy Street.  The menu has not changed much in the years that we have been going here.  Always a special of the day to consider.

The bakery is first rate.  I think they are some of the best scones we have had.  Coffee is good.  Never tried the espresso drinks.

The food is average +, but more than made up for by the fun eclectic atmosphere.  If you are put off by having to wait to order, wait for a table, be self-seated then Lazy Jane's  is not for you.  But if you don't mind waiting in line and gabbing with strangers then you will be o.k. here.

Our last visit the food was good.  Had The Works breakfast.  Very good.  Only criticism was that my potato's were a bit on the oily side, and the toast was a bit on the verge of being burnt.

All-in-all Lazy Jane's warrants a "recommend" if you are in the area.
